election.description: Election for State Superintendent of Public Instruction, Justice of the Supreme Court, Milwaukee County Circuit Court Judges (Branches 6, 11, 26, 36, 40, and 41), and Milwaukee Municipal Judge (Branch 1).

candidates.name: Brittany Kinser
policies: Prioritize curriculum on foundational subjects (reading, writing, math, science)
Increase transparency in school fund spending
Restore high academic standards
Support school choice for Wisconsin families
Modernize the school funding formula to shift funding burden to state
candidates.additionalNotes: Former special education teacher, education consultant, CEO at City Forward Collective; endorsed by Republicans.
candidates.position: Candidate for State Superintendent of Public Instruction
candidates.bio: Brittany Kinser has experience as a special education teacher and educational consultant. She currently serves as CEO of City Forward Collective.

candidates.name: Jill Underly
policies: Supports lower testing standards reflecting accurate student learning
Advocates increased state funding for public schools
Increase teacher recruitment and retention efforts
Supports career and technical education, literacy initiatives, and youth mental health programs
Opposes voucher expansion, supports public education funding equity
candidates.additionalNotes: Incumbent Superintendent, former assistant director of Wisconsin DPI, superintendent of Pecatonica Area School District.
candidates.position: Incumbent State Superintendent of Public Instruction
candidates.bio: Jill Underly is the incumbent Wisconsin Superintendent of Public Instruction with extensive educational administration experience.

candidates.name: Brad Schimel
policies: Pro-life stance supporting Wisconsin’s 1849 abortion ban
Support for gun rights
Supports limiting EPA authority and other environmental regulatory bodies
Opposes Affordable Care Act (Obamacare)
Supports voter ID laws and limits on early voting
candidates.additionalNotes: Judge for Waukesha County Circuit Court, former Wisconsin Attorney General.
candidates.position: Candidate for Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice
candidates.bio: Brad Schimel has served as Attorney General of Wisconsin and as a judge, holding conservative legal positions.

candidates.name: Susan Crawford
policies: Supports access to reproductive healthcare
Supports campaign finance regulation
Favors restorative justice and criminal justice diversion programs
Supports workers' rights and opposed Act 10
Supports nonpartisan redistricting and alternative voter verification methods
candidates.additionalNotes: Judge of Dane County Circuit Court, former chief legal counsel to Governor Jim Doyle.
candidates.position: Candidate for Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice
candidates.bio: Susan Crawford is a Dane County Circuit Judge with a liberal judicial philosophy advocating workers' rights and nonpartisan redistricting.
